messages.message:
My crafting sandbox has a number of containers stuck as stopping
```owner@dev:~$ cs logs server-nginx
âœ” select the only one - DAEMON:server-nginx@instabase
#27 ERROR: error writing layer blob: unexpected status from HEAD request to https://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/v2/instabase-build/server-nginx/blobs/sha256:383501b09ac595ef22166706cda4c7c882569129a3c0361784fbc1474ceed8b9: 403 Forbidden
------
 > importing cache manifest from 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/server-nginx:cache (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/server-nginx:cache):
------
------
 > exporting cache to registry:
------
ERROR: failed to solve: error writing layer blob: unexpected status from HEAD request to https://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/v2/instabase-build/server-nginx/blobs/sha256:383501b09ac595ef22166706cda4c7c882569129a3c0361784fbc1474ceed8b9: 403 Forbidden
make: *** [Makefile:61: build-docker] Error 1
make: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/webserver/server-nginx'
owner@dev:~$ cs restart server-nginx
daemon:server-nginx@instabase: Stopping```
I have done ecr-login. All the services are daemons - what is a safe way to force restart these containers
